heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded was on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm fell at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour over the 37.2 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain rate registered stands at 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  21.19mm fell during the storm over 15.0 hours.

longest_rain.status: The record duration for continuous rain was set on 04 January 2025, the storm lasted 37.2 hours with a total precipitation of 36.8mm and it reached 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning strikes in one day since 11 April 2025 was 23 and it happened on 07 September 2025.

nearest_lightning.status: The nearest lightning strike ever noted was on 13 May 2025, at 4.97 miles distance.

storm.status: Currently no stormy weather.  The most recent storm happened on 07 September 2025 and it lasted for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.7.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no heatwaves in progress.  So far, 6 heatwavess have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average wind direction is southerly (186°), which differs from the average south-westerly (234.0°) by approximately 48.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen was 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen was 1754 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The highest wind speed ever seen was 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 12.1°C) and outside temperature (down 10.5°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 10%).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in light levels (up 14465 lux) and cloud levels (up 1057 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 13769 lux) and cloud levels (up 965 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 1056.7m lower than yesterday, 446.5m lower than the past week, 964.6m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 928m to 5160m and averaged 1477.6m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures should be quite comfortable. Outside; cold temperatures are forecasted. Also, the air will feel dry and winds will be practically absent. Drizzle or light rain possible, cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times, and it’s dark. Weather could become unsettled.
